definition: (literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither

sentences.english: The ruling party is sure to start bickering if it loses next weekend.
sentences.chinese: 如果在下週末敗北，執政黨內肯定將開始爭吵。

sentences.english: That defeat proved to be Spain’s only loss of the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 這次敗北是西班牙此次世界盃摘冠之旅唯一敗績。

sentences.english: The girls playedwell, but Melissa's team lost.
sentences.chinese: 姑娘們打得很棒，但梅麗莎她們隊還是敗北了。

sentences.english: A one-sided gamble of inquiry, the beginner blade doubt to wantonly westerlo.
sentences.chinese: 一邊倒的賭局中，新手刀鋒毫無懸念地大肆敗北。

sentences.english: The French were defeated at the battle of Blenheim, which led to an end of French hegemony over Europe.
sentences.chinese: 布萊尼姆一役，法軍敗北，法國的歐洲霸權從此結束。

sentences.english: The U.S. has lost the green-technology race.
sentences.chinese: 美國已經在綠色技術競爭中敗北。

sentences.english: The pain from losing the NBA Finals ran that deep.
sentences.chinese: 總決賽敗北的痛好深好深。

definition: to garrison/to stand guard/on garrison duty
to nurse a grievance/to harbor a grudge
to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
to face off against one's adversary (military, sports etc)
to deliver a punishing attack/to deal a heavy blow
to go to war/to engage in war
